security_audit.summary: This is a benign WordPress development skill containing documentation and code templates. The included Python scaffold script generates PHP boilerplate code using safe string substitution. No malicious code patterns, credential theft, network calls, or code execution vulnerabilities were detected. All capabilities align with the stated purpose of WordPress development guidance.

content.value_statement: Creating WordPress themes and plugins requires understanding coding standards, security practices, and WordPress APIs. This skill provides comprehensive guidance and ready-to-use templates for professional WordPress development.
actual_capabilities: Generate custom post type code with labels and capabilities
Create custom taxonomy registrations with hierarchical support
Build admin meta boxes with secure save handlers
Implement REST API endpoints with authentication callbacks
Follow WordPress coding standards for PHP, JS, and CSS
Apply security best practices including sanitization and escaping
limitations: Does not execute code on WordPress installations
Does not modify live WordPress sites directly
Does not provide hosting or deployment services
Templates require manual integration into projects

output_examples.input: Create a 'Product' custom post type for an e-commerce site with price, SKU, and inventory fields.
output: Here's a complete custom post type registration with admin meta boxes:
• Supports: title, editor, thumbnail, custom fields, revisions
• REST API enabled with base URL: /wp-json/wp/v2/products
• Meta box includes: price (number), SKU (text), inventory (number), on_sale (checkbox)
• Nonce verification and capability checks in save handler

best_practices: Always sanitize input with WordPress functions like sanitize_text_field() before storing data
Escape output using esc_html(), esc_attr(), and esc_url() to prevent XSS attacks
Use $wpdb->prepare() for all database queries to prevent SQL injection
anti_patterns: Never use query_posts() - it breaks the main WordPress query and should be replaced with WP_Query
Do not store sensitive data in plain text options - use encryption for credentials and API keys
Avoid suppressing errors with the @ operator - it hides legitimate issues and slows performance

faq.question: Which WordPress versions are supported?
faq.answer: This skill covers WordPress 6.x and later. Templates use modern PHP 7.4+ features and block theme support.

faq.question: What are the limits on custom post types?
faq.answer: WordPress supports unlimited custom post types per site. Each requires careful capability mapping for security.

faq.question: Does this integrate with page builders?
faq.answer: Templates work with any WordPress setup. Custom fields show in block editor via standard meta box API integration.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using these templates?
faq.answer: All templates include security best practices: nonce verification, capability checks, input sanitization, and output escaping.

faq.question: Why is my custom post type not appearing?
faq.answer: Common causes: rewrite rules not flushed (save permalinks), registration priority too late, or incorrect labels causing failure.

faq.question: How does this compare to ACF or Pods?
faq.answer: This provides code-level understanding. Use ACF or Pods for rapid field creation. Understanding the code helps debug and customize.
